citations.narrative:
During inspection, the APHIS official requested APHIS Form 7005 and APHIS Form 7006 and the facility representative
stated all paperwork was with the traveling licensee on their dog show. The two forms requested are necessary to
maintain records of animals born on the property or purchased. Each dealer and exhibitor shall use Record of Acquisition
of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make,
keep, and maintain the information by paragraph (a)(1) of this section.
To be corrected by September 20, 2025.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
During inspection, the APHIS official asked the facility representative if they had submitted a travel itinerary since they
had stated the licensee was traveling with the dogs. The facility representative stated the itinerary had not been submitted
before the licensee left with the dogs. The itineraries are important to keep track of where animals are been moved to and
to assure the humane treatment of animals during transportation. The itinerary shall be received by the Deputy
Administrator no fewer than 2 days in advance of any travel and shall contain complete and accurate information
concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any location other than the person's approved site.
To be corrected by September 10, 2025.

During inspection, the APHIS official requested the exercise for dogs' plan, the facility representative described their
process, but the document was not available for review during inspection. Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise. In addition, the plan
must be approved by the attending veterinarian. The plan must include written standard procedures to be followed in
providing the opportunity for exercise. The plan must be made available to APHIS upon request, and, in case of research
facilities, to officials of any pertinent funding Federal agency.
To be corrected by September 20, 2025.

During inspection, APHIS official requested the program of veterinary care for dogs and the facility representative stated
that all paperwork was with the licensee who was traveling with the animals to a show. Documented veterinary care plan
for dogs must be signed by the attending veterinarian and made available for APHIS inspection. Each dealer, exhibitor,
and research facility must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is developed, documented in
writing, and signed by the attending veterinarian. Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must keep and maintain the
written program and make it available for APHIS inspection. The written program of veterinary care must address the
requirements for adequate veterinary care for every dealer and exhibitor in § 2.40 of this subchapter and every research
facility in § 2.33 of this subchapter.
To be corrected by September 20, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
During inspection, the APHIS official requested APHIS Form 7005 and APHIS Form 7006 and the facility representative 
stated all paperwork was with the traveling licensee on their dog show. The two forms requested are necessary to 
maintain records of animals born on the property or purchased. Each dealer and exhibitor shall use Record of Acquisition 
of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make, 
keep, and maintain the information by paragraph (a)(1) of this section. 
 
To be corrected by September 20, 2025. 
2.126(c) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
During inspection, the APHIS official asked the facility representative if they had submitted a travel itinerary since they 
had stated the licensee was traveling with the dogs. The facility representative stated the itinerary had not been submitted 
before the licensee left with the dogs. The itineraries are important to keep track of where animals are been moved to and 
to assure the humane treatment of animals during transportation. The itinerary shall be received by the Deputy 
Administrator no fewer than 2 days in advance of any travel and shall contain complete and accurate information 
concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any location other than the person's approved site. 
 
To be corrected by September 10, 2025. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
During inspection, the APHIS official requested the exercise for dogs' plan, the facility representative described their 
process, but the document was not available for review during inspection. Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must 
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise. In addition, the plan 
must be approved by the attending veterinarian. The plan must include written standard procedures to be followed in 
providing the opportunity for exercise. The plan must be made available to APHIS upon request, and, in case of research 
facilities, to officials of any pertinent funding Federal agency.

To be corrected by September 20, 2025. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
During inspection, APHIS official requested the program of veterinary care for dogs and the facility representative stated 
that all paperwork was with the licensee who was traveling with the animals to a show. Documented veterinary care plan 
for dogs must be signed by the attending veterinarian and made available for APHIS inspection. Each dealer, exhibitor, 
and research facility must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is developed, documented in 
writing, and signed by the attending veterinarian. Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must keep and maintain the 
written program and make it available for APHIS inspection. The written program of veterinary care must address the 
requirements for adequate veterinary care for every dealer and exhibitor in § 2.40 of this subchapter and every research 
facility in § 2.33 of this subchapter. 
 
To be corrected by September 20, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
